pages.title: üéí Inventory Overview
pages.description:
Your **Inventory** is where all your items live.

If you hoard items like a dragon: ‚úÖ Inventory.
If you're broke but still collecting junk: also ‚úÖ Inventory.

Inventory items are shown with:
‚Ä¢ item name
‚Ä¢ quantity (`X amount`)
‚Ä¢ rarity
‚Ä¢ description

fields.name: Core Commands
fields.value:
‚Ä¢ `!check inventory` - view your inventory
‚Ä¢ `!info <item>` - detailed item info
‚Ä¢ `/transfer_item <user> <item> <amount>` - give items to someone
‚Ä¢ `!use <item>` - use an item (only works if usable)

Examples:
`!checkinventory`
`!info copper ore`
`/transfer_item @user wooden box 2`
`!use bread`

fields.name: Quick Reminder
fields.value:
Items can be **traded**, **sold**, or sometimes **used**.
Some items (like loot boxes) are *not usable* with `!use`. They are opened via `!open`

pages.title: üîç Item Info (What is this thing?)
pages.description:
`!info` gives detailed information about an item.
This is what you use when you're staring at an item name like it's ancient scripture.

fields.name: What it shows
fields.value:
‚Ä¢ item name
‚Ä¢ description
‚Ä¢ rarity color
‚Ä¢ icon (if the item has one)
‚Ä¢ how many you own

fields.name: Typos & Suggestions
fields.value:
If you type the wrong item name, Veyra tries to suggest the closest match.

If your spelling is beyond saving, you'll get:
"Idk about anything like that."

pages.title: üéÅ Giving Items (Transfer System)
pages.description:
You can transfer items to other players (or even to Veyra).

Because sometimes generosity is cool.
And sometimes you're just clearing junk.

fields.name: Rules
fields.value:
‚úÖ Target must be a registered player
‚ùå You can't transfer to yourself
‚úÖ If the target is Veyra, special logic applies

fields.name: Veyra Transfers (Special)
fields.value:
If you transfer items to Veyra:
‚Ä¢ items are taken from you and given to her
‚Ä¢ you gain **friendship** with Veyra

So yes, you can bribe her. Nice.

fields.name: Common Errors
fields.value:
‚Ä¢ mistyped item ‚Üí suggestions
‚Ä¢ target not registered ‚Üí can't interact
‚Ä¢ receiver full ‚Üí transfer fails

pages.title: üß™ Using Items (Use vs Open)
pages.description: `!use` is only for items that are actually *usable*.

fields.name: Loot Boxes
fields.value:
Lootboxes cannot be used.
These include:
‚Ä¢ Wooden Box
‚Ä¢ Stone Box
‚Ä¢ Iron Box
‚Ä¢ Platinum Box

Instead use:
`!open wooden box`

fields.name: If you don‚Äôt own it
fields.value:
If you try using an item you don‚Äôt have, Veyra will block you.
Example:
"You don't have any <item>. Can't use!"

pages.title: üëù Pockets vs üéí Inventory (Super Important)
pages.description:
Veyra storage has **two upgrade paths** and they do *different* things:

üéí **Inventory = how many slots you own**
üëù **Pockets = how much each slot can hold**

So:
‚Ä¢ Inventory decides **how many different stacks you can store**
‚Ä¢ Pockets decides **how big each stack can be**

Upgrade both if you don‚Äôt want to live the painful "Inventory Full" lifestyle.

fields.name: üéí Inventory (Slot Count)
fields.value:
Inventory upgrades increase your **total slots**.

Each slot holds **one stack** of an item.
More slots = more different item stacks you can keep.

Example:
If you have **30 slots**, you can hold up to **30 stacks** (not 30 items).

fields.name: üëù Pockets (Stack Size per Slot)
fields.value:
Pockets upgrades increase **stack size limits** per slot.

Stack limits depend on the item rarity/category:
‚Ä¢ Common stacks bigger than Legendary
‚Ä¢ Minerals stack larger than normal items
‚Ä¢ Lootboxes have their own limits

Example:
If Common stack limit is **20**, one slot can hold **20 Common** items.

fields.name: So what does ‚ÄúInventory Full‚Äù mean?
fields.value:
It means you ran out of **free slots**, not that you hit some random total item limit.

Even if you have only 1 item type, if it needs multiple stacks:
`slots used = ceil(quantity / stack_limit)`

So if you're carrying 41 Common items and your stack limit is 20:
`ceil(41/20) = 3 slots used`

fields.name: The Smart Upgrade Strategy
fields.value:
‚Ä¢ Upgrade **Inventory** if you own many different items.
‚Ä¢ Upgrade **Pockets** if one item keeps overflowing into multiple stacks.

pages.title: ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Upgrading Storage (Inventory + Pockets)
pages.description:
Both **Inventory** and **Pockets** can be upgraded.

Upgrades follow Veyra‚Äôs "confirmation before buying" style.
So the bot won‚Äôt steal your gold instantly (rare W).

fields.name: How upgrades work
fields.value:
Upgrades are like buildings:
‚Ä¢ Veyra shows description + cost
‚Ä¢ you must type `yes` to confirm
‚Ä¢ if you don‚Äôt confirm in time ‚Üí cancelled

fields.name: Why upgrade?
fields.value:
More capacity =
‚Ä¢ accept more items
‚Ä¢ hold more loot
‚Ä¢ trade more
‚Ä¢ stop crying about "inventory full"
